Summary: Imperative, timeline-based animations with AnimationController. Compose Sequence/Parallel animations and receive tweened values via OnTick to update component state and UI.
Remarks: AnimationController is a VisualNode you render inside a component to orchestrate complex animations. It hosts a tree of Animation objects: containers (ParallelAnimation, SequenceAnimation) and tween animations (DoubleAnimation, CubicBezierPathAnimation, QuadraticBezierPathAnimation). Each animation has Duration and can be composed with initial delays and loops. Tween animations fire OnTick callbacks delivering values you can map to component State and bind in Render(). Control playback with IsPaused and IsEnabled (stop restores initial state). Prefer AnimationController for multi-step timelines, path motions, or coordinated property changes; use property-based animation for simple state transitions.
Example:
// Compose a controller with sequenced tween animations
new AnimationController
{
    new SequenceAnimation
    {
        new DoubleAnimation()
            .StartValue(0)
            .TargetValue(300)
            .Duration(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(2.5))
            .Easing(Easing.CubicOut)
            .OnTick(v => /* update state with v */),

        new DoubleAnimation()
            .StartValue(0)
            .TargetValue(300)
            .Duration(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(1.5))
            .OnTick(v => /* update state with v */)
    },

    new SequenceAnimation
    {
        new DoubleAnimation()
            .StartValue(0)
            .TargetValue(300)
            .Duration(TimeSpan.FromSeconds(2))
            .OnTick(v => /* update state with v */),

        new CubicBezierPathAnimation()
            .StartPoint(new Point(0,100))
            .EndPoint(new Point(300,100))
            .ControlPoint1(new Point(0,0))
            .ControlPoint2(new Point(300,200))
            .OnTick(p => /* update state with p.X/p.Y */),

        new QuadraticBezierPathAnimation()
            .StartPoint(new Point(300,100))
            .EndPoint(new Point(0,100))
            .ControlPoint(new Point(150,200))
            .OnTick(p => /* update state with p.X/p.Y */)
    }
}
